com.github.arthurfiorette.sinklibrary.executor

Class BukkitExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.arthurfiorette.sinklibrary.executor.BukkitExecutor

  • public final class BukkitExecutor
extends Object
    Simple interface to target all executors that runs with a BukkitScheduler.

      • newCachedThreadPool

        public ExecutorService newCachedThreadPool(BasePlugin plugin,
                                           TaskContext context)
        Creates a thread pool that creates new threads as needed, but will reuse previously constructed threads when they are available.
        Parameters:
        plugin - The basic plugin to assign to the created thread factory
        context - The thread context to be used
        Returns:
        the newly created thread pool
        See Also:
        BukkitThreadFactory

      • newFixedThreadPool

        public ExecutorService newFixedThreadPool(BasePlugin plugin,
                                          TaskContext context,
                                          int nThreads)
        Creates a thread pool that reuses a fixed number of threads operating off a shared unbounded queue, using the provided ThreadFactory to create new threads when needed. At any point, at most nThreads threads will be active processing tasks. If additional tasks are submitted when all threads are active, they will wait in the queue until a thread is available. If any thread terminates due to a failure during execution prior to shutdown, a new one will take its place if needed to execute subsequent tasks. The threads in the pool will exist until it is explicitly shutdown.
        Parameters:
        plugin - The basic plugin to assign to the created thread factory
        context - The thread context to be used
        nThreads - the number of threads in the pool
        Returns:
        the newly created thread pool
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if nThreads <= 0

      • newScheduledThreadPool

        public ScheduledExecutorService newScheduledThreadPool(BasePlugin plugin,
                                                       TaskContext context,
                                                       int corePoolSize)
        Creates a thread pool that can schedule commands to run after a given delay, or to execute periodically.
        Parameters:
        plugin - The basic plugin to assign to the created thread factory
        context - The thread context to be used
        corePoolSize - the number of threads to keep in the pool, even if they are idle
        Returns:
        a newly created scheduled thread pool
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if corePoolSize < 0

      • newSingleThreadExecutor

        public ExecutorService newSingleThreadExecutor(BasePlugin plugin,
                                               TaskContext context)
        Creates an Executor that uses a single worker thread operating off an unbounded queue, and uses the provided ThreadFactory to create a new thread when needed. Unlike the otherwise equivalent newFixedThreadPool(1, threadFactory) the returned executor is guaranteed not to be reconfigurable to use additional threads.
        Parameters:
        plugin - The basic plugin to assign to the created thread factory
        context - The thread context to be used
        Returns:
        the newly created single-threaded Executor

      • newSingleThreadScheduledExecutor

        public ScheduledExecutorService newSingleThreadScheduledExecutor(BasePlugin plugin,
                                                                 TaskContext context)
        Creates a single-threaded executor that can schedule commands to run after a given delay, or to execute periodically. (Note however that if this single thread terminates due to a failure during execution prior to shutdown, a new one will take its place if needed to execute subsequent tasks.) Tasks are guaranteed to execute sequentially, and no more than one task will be active at any given time.

        Unlike the otherwise equivalent newScheduledThreadPool(BasePlugin, TaskContext, int) the returned executor is guaranteed not to be reconfigurable to use additional threads.

        Parameters:
        plugin - The basic plugin to assign to the created thread factory
        context - The thread context to be used
        Returns:
        a newly created scheduled executor
